titles: A proposal humbly presented to the Right Honourable the House of Commons, by which it is reasonable to suppose a million may be raised (and as it is hoped much more) without oppressing any person, every one being at their liberty to pay, or not to pay
author: Malkin, G. (Gilbert)
notes: A proposal to sell licences to wear foreign apparel.
Reproduction of the original at the British Library.
keywords: Sumptuary laws --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Tariff on clothing --  England --  Early works to 1800.
